BatchGetTraces.name: BatchGetTraces
BatchGetTraces.documentation:
You cannot find traces through this API if Transaction Search is enabled since trace is not indexed in X-Ray.

Retrieves a list of traces specified by ID. Each trace is a collection of segment documents that originates from a single request. Use GetTraceSummaries to get a list of trace IDs.

CancelTraceRetrieval.name: CancelTraceRetrieval
CancelTraceRetrieval.documentation: Cancels an ongoing trace retrieval job initiated by StartTraceRetrieval using the provided RetrievalToken. A successful cancellation will return an HTTP 200 response.

CreateGroup.name: CreateGroup
CreateGroup.documentation: Creates a group resource with a name and a filter expression.

CreateSamplingRule.name: CreateSamplingRule
CreateSamplingRule.documentation: Creates a rule to control sampling behavior for instrumented applications. Services retrieve rules with GetSamplingRules, and evaluate each rule in ascending order of priority for each request. If a rule matches, the service records a trace, borrowing it from the reservoir size. After 10 seconds, the service reports back to X-Ray with GetSamplingTargets to get updated versions of each in-use rule. The updated rule contains a trace quota that the service can use instead of borrowing from the reservoir.

DeleteResourcePolicy.name: DeleteResourcePolicy
DeleteResourcePolicy.documentation: Deletes a resource policy from the target Amazon Web Services account.

GetEncryptionConfig.name: GetEncryptionConfig
GetEncryptionConfig.documentation: Retrieves the current encryption configuration for X-Ray data.

GetIndexingRules.name: GetIndexingRules
GetIndexingRules.documentation:
Retrieves all indexing rules.

Indexing rules are used to determine the server-side sampling rate for spans ingested through the CloudWatchLogs destination and indexed by X-Ray. For more information, see Transaction Search.

GetInsight.name: GetInsight
GetInsight.documentation: Retrieves the summary information of an insight. This includes impact to clients and root cause services, the top anomalous services, the category, the state of the insight, and the start and end time of the insight.

GetInsightEvents.name: GetInsightEvents
GetInsightEvents.documentation: X-Ray reevaluates insights periodically until they're resolved, and records each intermediate state as an event. You can review an insight's events in the Impact Timeline on the Inspect page in the X-Ray console.

GetInsightImpactGraph.name: GetInsightImpactGraph
GetInsightImpactGraph.documentation: Retrieves a service graph structure filtered by the specified insight. The service graph is limited to only structural information. For a complete service graph, use this API with the GetServiceGraph API.

GetInsightSummaries.name: GetInsightSummaries
GetInsightSummaries.documentation: Retrieves the summaries of all insights in the specified group matching the provided filter values.

GetRetrievedTracesGraph.name: GetRetrievedTracesGraph
GetRetrievedTracesGraph.documentation:
Retrieves a service graph for traces based on the specified RetrievalToken from the CloudWatch log group generated by Transaction Search. This API does not initiate a retrieval job. You must first execute StartTraceRetrieval to obtain the required RetrievalToken.

The trace graph describes services that process incoming requests and any downstream services they call, which may include Amazon Web Services resources, external APIs, or databases.

The response is empty until the RetrievalStatus is COMPLETE. Retry the request after the status changes from RUNNING or SCHEDULED to COMPLETE to access the full service graph.

When CloudWatch log is the destination, this API can support cross-account observability and service graph retrieval across linked accounts.

For retrieving graphs from X-Ray directly as opposed to the Transaction-Search Log group, see GetTraceGraph.

GetSamplingStatisticSummaries.name: GetSamplingStatisticSummaries
GetSamplingStatisticSummaries.documentation: Retrieves information about recent sampling results for all sampling rules.

GetSamplingTargets.name: GetSamplingTargets
GetSamplingTargets.documentation: Requests a sampling quota for rules that the service is using to sample requests.

GetServiceGraph.name: GetServiceGraph
GetServiceGraph.documentation: Retrieves a document that describes services that process incoming requests, and downstream services that they call as a result. Root services process incoming requests and make calls to downstream services. Root services are applications that use the Amazon Web Services X-Ray SDK. Downstream services can be other applications, Amazon Web Services resources, HTTP web APIs, or SQL databases.

GetTimeSeriesServiceStatistics.name: GetTimeSeriesServiceStatistics
GetTimeSeriesServiceStatistics.documentation: Get an aggregation of service statistics defined by a specific time range.

GetTraceGraph.name: GetTraceGraph
GetTraceGraph.documentation: Retrieves a service graph for one or more specific trace IDs.

GetTraceSegmentDestination.name: GetTraceSegmentDestination
GetTraceSegmentDestination.documentation: Retrieves the current destination of data sent to PutTraceSegments and OpenTelemetry protocol (OTLP) endpoint. The Transaction Search feature requires a CloudWatchLogs destination. For more information, see Transaction Search and OpenTelemetry.

GetTraceSummaries.name: GetTraceSummaries
GetTraceSummaries.documentation:
Retrieves IDs and annotations for traces available for a specified time frame using an optional filter. To get the full traces, pass the trace IDs to BatchGetTraces.

A filter expression can target traced requests that hit specific service nodes or edges, have errors, or come from a known user. For example, the following filter expression targets traces that pass through api.example.com:

service("api.example.com")

This filter expression finds traces that have an annotation named account with the value 12345:

annotation.account = "12345"

For a full list of indexed fields and keywords that you can use in filter expressions, see Use filter expressions in the Amazon Web Services X-Ray Developer Guide.

ListResourcePolicies.name: ListResourcePolicies
ListResourcePolicies.documentation: Returns the list of resource policies in the target Amazon Web Services account.

ListRetrievedTraces.name: ListRetrievedTraces
ListRetrievedTraces.documentation:
Retrieves a list of traces for a given RetrievalToken from the CloudWatch log group generated by Transaction Search. For information on what each trace returns, see BatchGetTraces.

This API does not initiate a retrieval process. To start a trace retrieval, use StartTraceRetrieval, which generates the required RetrievalToken.

When the RetrievalStatus is not COMPLETE, the API will return an empty response. Retry the request once the retrieval has completed to access the full list of traces.

For cross-account observability, this API can retrieve traces from linked accounts when CloudWatch log is set as the destination across relevant accounts. For more details, see CloudWatch cross-account observability.

For retrieving data from X-Ray directly as opposed to the Transaction Search generated log group, see BatchGetTraces.

ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource.documentation: Returns a list of tags that are applied to the specified Amazon Web Services X-Ray group or sampling rule.

PutEncryptionConfig.name: PutEncryptionConfig
PutEncryptionConfig.documentation: Updates the encryption configuration for X-Ray data.

PutResourcePolicy.name: PutResourcePolicy
PutResourcePolicy.documentation: Sets the resource policy to grant one or more Amazon Web Services services and accounts permissions to access X-Ray. Each resource policy will be associated with a specific Amazon Web Services account. Each Amazon Web Services account can have a maximum of 5 resource policies, and each policy name must be unique within that account. The maximum size of each resource policy is 5KB.

PutTelemetryRecords.name: PutTelemetryRecords
PutTelemetryRecords.documentation: Used by the Amazon Web Services X-Ray daemon to upload telemetry.

PutTraceSegments.name: PutTraceSegments
PutTraceSegments.documentation:
Uploads segment documents to Amazon Web Services X-Ray. A segment document can be a completed segment, an in-progress segment, or an array of subsegments.

Segments must include the following fields. For the full segment document schema, see Amazon Web Services X-Ray Segment Documents in the Amazon Web Services X-Ray Developer Guide.

Required segment document fields

  • name - The name of the service that handled the request.

  • id - A 64-bit identifier for the segment, unique among segments in the same trace, in 16 hexadecimal digits.

  • trace_id - A unique identifier that connects all segments and subsegments originating from a single client request.

  • start_time - Time the segment or subsegment was created, in floating point seconds in epoch time, accurate to milliseconds. For example, 1480615200.010 or 1.480615200010E9.

  • end_time - Time the segment or subsegment was closed. For example, 1480615200.090 or 1.480615200090E9. Specify either an end_time or in_progress.

  • in_progress - Set to true instead of specifying an end_time to record that a segment has been started, but is not complete. Send an in-progress segment when your application receives a request that will take a long time to serve, to trace that the request was received. When the response is sent, send the complete segment to overwrite the in-progress segment.

A trace_id consists of three numbers separated by hyphens. For example, 1-58406520-a006649127e371903a2de979. For trace IDs created by an X-Ray SDK, or by Amazon Web Services services integrated with X-Ray, a trace ID includes:

Trace ID Format

  • The version number, for instance, 1.

  • The time of the original request, in Unix epoch time, in 8 hexadecimal digits. For example, 10:00AM December 2nd, 2016 PST in epoch time is 1480615200 seconds, or 58406520 in hexadecimal.

  • A 96-bit identifier for the trace, globally unique, in 24 hexadecimal digits.

Trace IDs created via OpenTelemetry have a different format based on the W3C Trace Context specification. A W3C trace ID must be formatted in the X-Ray trace ID format when sending to X-Ray. For example, a W3C trace ID 4efaaf4d1e8720b39541901950019ee5 should be formatted as 1-4efaaf4d-1e8720b39541901950019ee5 when sending to X-Ray. While X-Ray trace IDs include the original request timestamp in Unix epoch time, this is not required or validated.

StartTraceRetrieval.name: StartTraceRetrieval
StartTraceRetrieval.documentation:
Initiates a trace retrieval process using the specified time range and for the given trace IDs in the Transaction Search generated CloudWatch log group. For more information, see Transaction Search.

API returns a RetrievalToken, which can be used with ListRetrievedTraces or GetRetrievedTracesGraph to fetch results. Retrievals will time out after 60 minutes. To execute long time ranges, consider segmenting into multiple retrievals.

If you are using CloudWatch cross-account observability, you can use this operation in a monitoring account to retrieve data from a linked source account, as long as both accounts have transaction search enabled.

For retrieving data from X-Ray directly as opposed to the Transaction-Search Log group, see BatchGetTraces.

TagResource.name: TagResource
TagResource.documentation: Applies tags to an existing Amazon Web Services X-Ray group or sampling rule.

UntagResource.name: UntagResource
UntagResource.documentation: Removes tags from an Amazon Web Services X-Ray group or sampling rule. You cannot edit or delete system tags (those with an aws: prefix).

UpdateIndexingRule.name: UpdateIndexingRule
UpdateIndexingRule.documentation:
Modifies an indexing ruleâ€™s configuration.

Indexing rules are used for determining the sampling rate for spans indexed from CloudWatch Logs. For more information, see Transaction Search.

UpdateTraceSegmentDestination.name: UpdateTraceSegmentDestination
UpdateTraceSegmentDestination.documentation: Modifies the destination of data sent to PutTraceSegments. The Transaction Search feature requires the CloudWatchLogs destination. For more information, see Transaction Search.

Names.documentation: A list of names for the alias, including the canonical name.

AnnotationValue.documentation: Value of a segment annotation. Has one of three value types: Number, Boolean, or String.

AnomalousService.documentation: The service within the service graph that has anomalously high fault rates.

Name.documentation: The name of a corresponding Availability Zone.

AvailabilityZoneDetail.documentation: A list of Availability Zones corresponding to the segments in a trace.

TraceIds.documentation: Specify the trace IDs of requests for which to retrieve segments.

UnprocessedTraceIds.documentation: Trace IDs of requests that haven't been processed.

GroupName.documentation: The case-sensitive name of the new group. Default is a reserved name and names must be unique.

FilterExpression.documentation: The filter expression defining criteria by which to group traces.

InsightsConfiguration.documentation:
The structure containing configurations related to insights.

  • The InsightsEnabled boolean can be set to true to enable insights for the new group or false to disable insights for the new group.

  • The NotificationsEnabled boolean can be set to true to enable insights notifications for the new group. Notifications may only be enabled on a group with InsightsEnabled set to true.

Tags.documentation:
A map that contains one or more tag keys and tag values to attach to an X-Ray group. For more information about ways to use tags, see Tagging Amazon Web Services resources in the Amazon Web Services General Reference.

The following restrictions apply to tags:

  • Maximum number of user-applied tags per resource: 50

  • Maximum tag key length: 128 Unicode characters

  • Maximum tag value length: 256 Unicode characters

  • Valid values for key and value: a-z, A-Z, 0-9, space, and the following characters: _ . : / = + - and @

  • Tag keys and values are case sensitive.

  • Don't use aws: as a prefix for keys; it's reserved for Amazon Web Services use.

Group.documentation: The group that was created. Contains the name of the group that was created, the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the group that was generated based on the group name, the filter expression, and the insight configuration that was assigned to the group.

Tags.documentation:
A map that contains one or more tag keys and tag values to attach to an X-Ray sampling rule. For more information about ways to use tags, see Tagging Amazon Web Services resources in the Amazon Web Services General Reference.

The following restrictions apply to tags:

  • Maximum number of user-applied tags per resource: 50

  • Maximum tag key length: 128 Unicode characters

  • Maximum tag value length: 256 Unicode characters

  • Valid values for key and value: a-z, A-Z, 0-9, space, and the following characters: _ . : / = + - and @

  • Tag keys and values are case sensitive.

  • Don't use aws: as a prefix for keys; it's reserved for Amazon Web Services use.

GroupARN.documentation: The ARN of the group that was generated on creation.

PolicyName.documentation: The name of the resource policy to delete.

PolicyRevisionId.documentation: Specifies a specific policy revision to delete. Provide a PolicyRevisionId to ensure an atomic delete operation. If the provided revision id does not match the latest policy revision id, an InvalidPolicyRevisionIdException exception is returned.

RuleName.documentation: The name of the sampling rule. Specify a rule by either name or ARN, but not both.

RuleARN.documentation: The ARN of the sampling rule. Specify a rule by either name or ARN, but not both.

ReferenceId.documentation: Identifier of the edge. Unique within a service map.

StartTime.documentation: The start time of the first segment on the edge.

EndTime.documentation: The end time of the last segment on the edge.

SummaryStatistics.documentation: Response statistics for segments on the edge.

ResponseTimeHistogram.documentation: A histogram that maps the spread of client response times on an edge. Only populated for synchronous edges.

EdgeType.documentation: Describes an asynchronous connection, with a value of link.

ReceivedEventAgeHistogram.documentation: A histogram that maps the spread of event age when received by consumers. Age is calculated each time an event is received. Only populated when EdgeType is link.

Edge.documentation: Information about a connection between two services. An edge can be a synchronous connection, such as typical call between client and service, or an asynchronous link, such as a Lambda function which retrieves an event from an SNS queue.

OkCount.documentation: The number of requests that completed with a 2xx Success status code.

ErrorStatistics.documentation: Information about requests that failed with a 4xx Client Error status code.

FaultStatistics.documentation: Information about requests that failed with a 5xx Server Error status code.

TotalResponseTime.documentation: The aggregate response time of completed requests.

KeyId.documentation: The ID of the KMS key used for encryption, if applicable.

Status.documentation: The encryption status. While the status is UPDATING, X-Ray may encrypt data with a combination of the new and old settings.

Type.documentation: The type of encryption. Set to KMS for encryption with KMS keys. Set to NONE for default encryption.

EncryptionConfig.documentation: A configuration document that specifies encryption configuration settings.

Services.documentation: A list of services corresponding to an error. A service identifies a segment and it contains a name, account ID, type, and inferred flag.

ClientImpacting.documentation: A flag that denotes that the root cause impacts the trace client.

ErrorRootCause.documentation: The root cause of a trace summary error.

Exceptions.documentation: The types and messages of the exceptions.

Remote.documentation: A flag that denotes a remote subsegment.

ErrorRootCauseEntity.documentation: A collection of segments and corresponding subsegments associated to a trace summary error.

AccountId.documentation: The account ID associated to the service.

EntityPath.documentation: The path of root cause entities found on the service.

Inferred.documentation: A Boolean value indicating if the service is inferred from the trace.

ErrorRootCauseService.documentation: A collection of fields identifying the services in a trace summary error.

ThrottleCount.documentation: The number of requests that failed with a 429 throttling status code.

OtherCount.documentation: The number of requests that failed with untracked 4xx Client Error status codes.

TotalCount.documentation: The total number of requests that failed with a 4xx Client Error status code.

ErrorStatistics.documentation: Information about requests that failed with a 4xx Client Error status code.

Services.documentation: A list of corresponding services. A service identifies a segment and it contains a name, account ID, type, and inferred flag.

ClientImpacting.documentation: A flag that denotes that the root cause impacts the trace client.

FaultRootCause.documentation: The root cause information for a trace summary fault.

Exceptions.documentation: The types and messages of the exceptions.

Remote.documentation: A flag that denotes a remote subsegment.

FaultRootCauseEntity.documentation: A collection of segments and corresponding subsegments associated to a trace summary fault error.

AccountId.documentation: The account ID associated to the service.

EntityPath.documentation: The path of root cause entities found on the service.

Inferred.documentation: A Boolean value indicating if the service is inferred from the trace.

FaultRootCauseService.documentation: A collection of fields identifying the services in a trace summary fault.

OtherCount.documentation: The number of requests that failed with untracked 5xx Server Error status codes.

TotalCount.documentation: The total number of requests that failed with a 5xx Server Error status code.

FaultStatistics.documentation: Information about requests that failed with a 5xx Server Error status code.

FaultCountHigh.documentation: The upper limit of fault counts for a service.

FaultCountLow.documentation: The lower limit of fault counts for a service.

ForecastStatistics.documentation: The predicted high and low fault count. This is used to determine if a service has become anomalous and if an insight should be created.

GroupARN.documentation: The ARN of the group that was generated on creation.

Group.documentation: The group that was requested. Contains the name of the group, the ARN of the group, the filter expression, and the insight configuration assigned to the group.

NextToken.documentation: Specify the pagination token returned by a previous request to retrieve the next page of indexes.
Specify the pagination token returned by a previous request to retrieve the next page of indexes.

InsightId.documentation: The insight's unique identifier. Use the GetInsightSummaries action to retrieve an InsightId.

MaxResults.documentation: Used to retrieve at most the specified value of events.

NextToken.documentation: Specify the pagination token returned by a previous request to retrieve the next page of events.

InsightEvents.documentation: A detailed description of the event. This includes the time of the event, client and root cause impact statistics, and the top anomalous service at the time of the event.

NextToken.documentation: Use this token to retrieve the next page of insight events.

InsightId.documentation: The insight's unique identifier. Use the GetInsightSummaries action to retrieve an InsightId.

StartTime.documentation: The estimated start time of the insight, in Unix time seconds. The StartTime is inclusive of the value provided and can't be more than 30 days old.

EndTime.documentation: The estimated end time of the insight, in Unix time seconds. The EndTime is exclusive of the value provided. The time range between the start time and end time can't be more than six hours.

NextToken.documentation: Specify the pagination token returned by a previous request to retrieve the next page of results.

ServiceGraphStartTime.documentation: The time, in Unix seconds, at which the service graph started.

ServiceGraphEndTime.documentation: The time, in Unix seconds, at which the service graph ended.

Services.documentation: The Amazon Web Services instrumented services related to the insight.

InsightId.documentation: The insight's unique identifier. Use the GetInsightSummaries action to retrieve an InsightId.

GroupARN.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the group. Required if the GroupName isn't provided.

GroupName.documentation: The name of the group. Required if the GroupARN isn't provided.

StartTime.documentation: The beginning of the time frame in which the insights started. The start time can't be more than 30 days old.

EndTime.documentation: The end of the time frame in which the insights ended. The end time can't be more than 30 days old.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to display.

InsightSummaries.documentation: The summary of each insight within the group matching the provided filters. The summary contains the InsightID, start and end time, the root cause service, the root cause and client impact statistics, the top anomalous services, and the status of the insight.

NextToken.documentation: Specify the pagination token returned by a previous request to retrieve the next page of indexes.
Specify the pagination token returned by a previous request to retrieve the next page of indexes.

SamplingStatisticSummaries.documentation: Information about the number of requests instrumented for each sampling rule.

SamplingStatisticsDocuments.documentation: Information about rules that the service is using to sample requests.

SamplingBoostStatisticsDocuments.documentation: Information about rules that the service is using to boost sampling rate.

SamplingTargetDocuments.documentation: Updated rules that the service should use to sample requests.

LastRuleModification.documentation: The last time a user changed the sampling rule configuration. If the sampling rule configuration changed since the service last retrieved it, the service should call GetSamplingRules to get the latest version.

UnprocessedStatistics.documentation: Information about SamplingStatisticsDocument that X-Ray could not process.

UnprocessedBoostStatistics.documentation: Information about SamplingBoostStatisticsDocument that X-Ray could not process.

StartTime.documentation: The start of the time frame for which to generate a graph.

EndTime.documentation: The end of the timeframe for which to generate a graph.

GroupName.documentation: The name of a group based on which you want to generate a graph.

GroupARN.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a group based on which you want to generate a graph.

StartTime.documentation: The start of the time frame for which the graph was generated.

EndTime.documentation: The end of the time frame for which the graph was generated.

Services.documentation: The services that have processed a traced request during the specified time frame.

ContainsOldGroupVersions.documentation: A flag indicating whether the group's filter expression has been consistent, or if the returned service graph may show traces from an older version of the group's filter expression.

StartTime.documentation: The start of the time frame for which to aggregate statistics.

EndTime.documentation: The end of the time frame for which to aggregate statistics.

GroupName.documentation: The case-sensitive name of the group for which to pull statistics from.

GroupARN.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the group for which to pull statistics from.

EntitySelectorExpression.documentation: A filter expression defining entities that will be aggregated for statistics. Supports ID, service, and edge functions. If no selector expression is specified, edge statistics are returned.

ForecastStatistics.documentation: The forecasted high and low fault count values. Forecast enabled requests require the EntitySelectorExpression ID be provided.

ContainsOldGroupVersions.documentation: A flag indicating whether or not a group's filter expression has been consistent, or if a returned aggregation might show statistics from an older version of the group's filter expression.

TraceIds.documentation: Trace IDs of requests for which to generate a service graph.

Services.documentation: The services that have processed one of the specified requests.

StartTime.documentation: The start of the time frame for which to retrieve traces.

EndTime.documentation: The end of the time frame for which to retrieve traces.

TimeRangeType.documentation: Query trace summaries by TraceId (trace start time), Event (trace update time), or Service (trace segment end time).

Sampling.documentation: Set to true to get summaries for only a subset of available traces.

SamplingStrategy.documentation: A parameter to indicate whether to enable sampling on trace summaries. Input parameters are Name and Value.

FilterExpression.documentation: Specify a filter expression to retrieve trace summaries for services or requests that meet certain requirements.

NextToken.documentation: Specify the pagination token returned by a previous request to retrieve the next page of results.

TraceSummaries.documentation: Trace IDs and annotations for traces that were found in the specified time frame.

ApproximateTime.documentation: The start time of this page of results.

TracesProcessedCount.documentation: The total number of traces processed, including traces that did not match the specified filter expression.

NextToken.documentation: If the requested time frame contained more than one page of results, you can use this token to retrieve the next page. The first page contains the most recent results, closest to the end of the time frame.

ReferenceType.documentation: Relationship of a trace to the corresponding service.

SourceTraceId.documentation: Source trace of a link relationship.

DestinationTraceIds.documentation: Destination traces of a link relationship.

GroupName.documentation: The unique case-sensitive name of the group.

GroupARN.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the group generated based on the GroupName.

FilterExpression.documentation: The filter expression defining the parameters to include traces.

InsightsConfiguration.documentation:
The structure containing configurations related to insights.

  • The InsightsEnabled boolean can be set to true to enable insights for the group or false to disable insights for the group.

  • The NotificationsEnabled boolean can be set to true to enable insights notifications through Amazon EventBridge for the group.

GroupName.documentation: The unique case-sensitive name of the group.

GroupARN.documentation: The ARN of the group generated based on the GroupName.

FilterExpression.documentation: The filter expression defining the parameters to include traces.

InsightsConfiguration.documentation:
The structure containing configurations related to insights.

  • The InsightsEnabled boolean can be set to true to enable insights for the group or false to disable insights for the group.

  • The NotificationsEnabled boolean can be set to true to enable insights notifications. Notifications can only be enabled on a group with InsightsEnabled set to true.

HistogramEntry.documentation: An entry in a histogram for a statistic. A histogram maps the range of observed values on the X axis, and the prevalence of each value on the Y axis.

Name.documentation: The name of the indexing rule.

ModifiedAt.documentation: Displays when the rule was last modified, in Unix time seconds.

IndexingRule.documentation: Rule used to determine the server-side sampling rate for spans ingested through the CloudWatchLogs destination and indexed by X-Ray.

Probabilistic.documentation: Indexing rule configuration that is used to probabilistically sample traceIds.
Indexing rule configuration that is used to probabilistically sample traceIds.

GroupARN.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the group that the insight belongs to.

GroupName.documentation: The name of the group that the insight belongs to.

Categories.documentation: The categories that label and describe the type of insight.

StartTime.documentation: The time, in Unix seconds, at which the insight began.

EndTime.documentation: The time, in Unix seconds, at which the insight ended.

ClientRequestImpactStatistics.documentation: The impact statistics of the client side service. This includes the number of requests to the client service and whether the requests were faults or okay.

RootCauseServiceRequestImpactStatistics.documentation: The impact statistics of the root cause service. This includes the number of requests to the client service and whether the requests were faults or okay.

TopAnomalousServices.documentation: The service within the insight that is most impacted by the incident.

Insight.documentation: When fault rates go outside of the expected range, X-Ray creates an insight. Insights tracks emergent issues within your applications.

EventTime.documentation: The time, in Unix seconds, at which the event was recorded.

ClientRequestImpactStatistics.documentation: The impact statistics of the client side service. This includes the number of requests to the client service and whether the requests were faults or okay.

RootCauseServiceRequestImpactStatistics.documentation: The impact statistics of the root cause service. This includes the number of requests to the client service and whether the requests were faults or okay.

TopAnomalousServices.documentation: The service during the event that is most impacted by the incident.

InsightEvent.documentation: X-Ray reevaluates insights periodically until they are resolved, and records each intermediate state in an event. You can review incident events in the Impact Timeline on the Inspect page in the X-Ray console.

ReferenceId.documentation: Identifier of the edge. Unique within a service map.

InsightImpactGraphEdge.documentation: The connection between two service in an insight impact graph.

ReferenceId.documentation: Identifier for the service. Unique within the service map.

Type.documentation:
Identifier for the service. Unique within the service map.

  • Amazon Web Services Resource - The type of an Amazon Web Services resource. For example, AWS::EC2::Instance for an application running on Amazon EC2 or AWS::DynamoDB::Table for an Amazon DynamoDB table that the application used.

  • Amazon Web Services Service - The type of an Amazon Web Services service. For example, AWS::DynamoDB for downstream calls to Amazon DynamoDB that didn't target a specific table.

  • Amazon Web Services Service - The type of an Amazon Web Services service. For example, AWS::DynamoDB for downstream calls to Amazon DynamoDB that didn't target a specific table.

  • remote - A downstream service of indeterminate type.

Names.documentation: A list of names for the service, including the canonical name.

AccountId.documentation: Identifier of the Amazon Web Services account in which the service runs.

InsightImpactGraphService.documentation: Information about an application that processed requests, users that made requests, or downstream services, resources, and applications that an application used.

GroupARN.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the group that the insight belongs to.

GroupName.documentation: The name of the group that the insight belongs to.

Categories.documentation: Categories The categories that label and describe the type of insight.

StartTime.documentation: The time, in Unix seconds, at which the insight began.

EndTime.documentation: The time, in Unix seconds, at which the insight ended.

ClientRequestImpactStatistics.documentation: The impact statistics of the client side service. This includes the number of requests to the client service and whether the requests were faults or okay.

RootCauseServiceRequestImpactStatistics.documentation: The impact statistics of the root cause service. This includes the number of requests to the client service and whether the requests were faults or okay.

TopAnomalousServices.documentation: The service within the insight that is most impacted by the incident.

LastUpdateTime.documentation: The time, in Unix seconds, that the insight was last updated.

InsightsEnabled.documentation: Set the InsightsEnabled value to true to enable insights or false to disable insights.

NotificationsEnabled.documentation: Set the NotificationsEnabled value to true to enable insights notifications. Notifications can only be enabled on a group with InsightsEnabled set to true.

InsightsConfiguration.documentation: The structure containing configurations related to insights.

Id.documentation: The ID of a corresponding EC2 instance.

InstanceIdDetail.documentation: A list of EC2 instance IDs corresponding to the segments in a trace.

InvalidPolicyRevisionIdException.documentation: A policy revision id was provided which does not match the latest policy revision. This exception is also if a policy revision id of 0 is provided via PutResourcePolicy and a policy with the same name already exists.

InvalidRequestException.documentation: The request is missing required parameters or has invalid parameters.

ResourcePolicies.documentation: The list of resource policies in the target Amazon Web Services account.

NextToken.documentation: Specify the pagination token returned by a previous request to retrieve the next page of indexes.

Traces.documentation: Full traces for the specified requests.

NextToken.documentation: Specify the pagination token returned by a previous request to retrieve the next page of indexes.

ResourceARN.documentation: The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of an X-Ray group or sampling rule.

NextToken.documentation: A pagination token. If multiple pages of results are returned, use the NextToken value returned with the current page of results as the value of this parameter to get the next page of results.

Tags.documentation: A list of tags, as key and value pairs, that is associated with the specified X-Ray group or sampling rule.

NextToken.documentation: A pagination token. If multiple pages of results are returned, use the NextToken value returned with the current page of results to get the next page of results.

LockoutPreventionException.documentation: The provided resource policy would prevent the caller of this request from calling PutResourcePolicy in the future.

PolicyCountLimitExceededException.documentation: Exceeded the maximum number of resource policies for a target Amazon Web Services account.

PolicySizeLimitExceededException.documentation: Exceeded the maximum size for a resource policy.

DesiredSamplingPercentage.documentation: Configured sampling percentage of traceIds. Note that sampling can be subject to limits to ensure completeness of data.

ProbabilisticRuleValue.documentation: The indexing rule configuration for probabilistic sampling.

DesiredSamplingPercentage.documentation: Configured sampling percentage of traceIds. Note that sampling can be subject to limits to ensure completeness of data.

ProbabilisticRuleValueUpdate.documentation: Update to the indexing rule configuration for probabilistic sampling.

KeyId.documentation:
An Amazon Web Services KMS key in one of the following formats:

  • Alias - The name of the key. For example, alias/MyKey.

  • Key ID - The KMS key ID of the key. For example, ae4aa6d49-a4d8-9df9-a475-4ff6d7898456. Amazon Web Services X-Ray does not support asymmetric KMS keys.

  • ARN - The full Amazon Resource Name of the key ID or alias. For example, arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:123456789012:key/ae4aa6d49-a4d8-9df9-a475-4ff6d7898456. Use this format to specify a key in a different account.

Omit this key if you set Type to NONE.

Type.documentation: The type of encryption. Set to KMS to use your own key for encryption. Set to NONE for default encryption.

PolicyName.documentation: The name of the resource policy. Must be unique within a specific Amazon Web Services account.

PolicyDocument.documentation: The resource policy document, which can be up to 5kb in size.

PolicyRevisionId.documentation:
Specifies a specific policy revision, to ensure an atomic create operation. By default the resource policy is created if it does not exist, or updated with an incremented revision id. The revision id is unique to each policy in the account.

If the policy revision id does not match the latest revision id, the operation will fail with an InvalidPolicyRevisionIdException exception. You can also provide a PolicyRevisionId of 0. In this case, the operation will fail with an InvalidPolicyRevisionIdException exception if a resource policy with the same name already exists.

BypassPolicyLockoutCheck.documentation:
A flag to indicate whether to bypass the resource policy lockout safety check.

Setting this value to true increases the risk that the policy becomes unmanageable. Do not set this value to true indiscriminately.

Use this parameter only when you include a policy in the request and you intend to prevent the principal that is making the request from making a subsequent PutResourcePolicy request.

The default value is false.

ResourcePolicy.documentation: The resource policy document, as provided in the PutResourcePolicyRequest.

TraceSegmentDocuments.documentation: A string containing a JSON document defining one or more segments or subsegments.

FaultCount.documentation: The number of requests that have resulted in a fault,

TotalCount.documentation: The total number of requests to the service.

RequestImpactStatistics.documentation: Statistics that describe how the incident has impacted a service.

ResourceARNDetail.documentation: A list of resources ARNs corresponding to the segments in a trace.

ResourceNotFoundException.documentation: The resource was not found. Verify that the name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource is correct.

PolicyName.documentation: The name of the resource policy. Must be unique within a specific Amazon Web Services account.

PolicyDocument.documentation: The resource policy document, which can be up to 5kb in size.

PolicyRevisionId.documentation: Returns the current policy revision id for this policy name.

LastUpdatedTime.documentation: When the policy was last updated, in Unix time seconds.

ResourcePolicy.documentation: A resource policy grants one or more Amazon Web Services services and accounts permissions to access X-Ray. Each resource policy is associated with a specific Amazon Web Services account.

Services.documentation: A list of corresponding services. A service identifies a segment and contains a name, account ID, type, and inferred flag.

ClientImpacting.documentation: A flag that denotes that the root cause impacts the trace client.

ResponseTimeRootCause.documentation: The root cause information for a response time warning.

Coverage.documentation: The type and messages of the exceptions.

Remote.documentation: A flag that denotes a remote subsegment.

ResponseTimeRootCauseEntity.documentation: A collection of segments and corresponding subsegments associated to a response time warning.

AccountId.documentation: The account ID associated to the service.

EntityPath.documentation: The path of root cause entities found on the service.

Inferred.documentation: A Boolean value indicating if the service is inferred from the trace.

ResponseTimeRootCauseService.documentation: A collection of fields identifying the service in a response time warning.

RetrievedService.documentation: Retrieved information about an application that processed requests, users that made requests, or downstream services, resources, and applications that an application used.

Id.documentation: The unique identifier for the span.

Duration.documentation: The length of time in seconds between the start time of the root span and the end time of the last span that completed.

RetrievedTrace.documentation: Retrieved collection of spans with matching trace IDs.

RootCauseException.documentation: The exception associated with a root cause.

RuleLimitExceededException.documentation: You have reached the maximum number of sampling rules.

BoostRate.documentation: The calculated sampling boost rate for this service

SamplingBoost.documentation: Temporary boost sampling rate. X-Ray calculates sampling boost for each service based on the recent sampling boost stats of all services that called GetSamplingTargets.

ServiceName.documentation: Matches the name that the service uses to identify itself in segments.

TotalCount.documentation: The number of requests that associated to the rule.

SampledAnomalyCount.documentation: The number of requests with anomaly recorded.

SamplingBoostStatisticsDocument.documentation: Request anomaly stats for a single rule from a service. Results are for the last 10 seconds unless the service has been assigned a longer reporting interval after a previous call to GetSamplingTargets.

MaxRate.documentation: Defines max temporary sampling rate to apply when a boost is triggered. Calculated boost rate by X-Ray will be less than or equal to this max rate.

CooldownWindowMinutes.documentation: Sets the time window (in minutes) in which only one sampling rate boost can be triggered. After a boost occurs, no further boosts are allowed until the next window.

SamplingRateBoost.documentation: Enable temporary sampling rate increases when you detect anomalies to improve visibility.

RuleName.documentation: The name of the sampling rule. Specify a rule by either name or ARN, but not both.

RuleARN.documentation: The ARN of the sampling rule. Specify a rule by either name or ARN, but not both.

ResourceARN.documentation: Matches the ARN of the Amazon Web Services resource on which the service runs.

FixedRate.documentation: The percentage of matching requests to instrument, after the reservoir is exhausted.

ReservoirSize.documentation: A fixed number of matching requests to instrument per second, prior to applying the fixed rate. The reservoir is not used directly by services, but applies to all services using the rule collectively.

ServiceName.documentation: Matches the name that the service uses to identify itself in segments.

ServiceType.documentation: Matches the origin that the service uses to identify its type in segments.

Host.documentation: Matches the hostname from a request URL.

HTTPMethod.documentation: Matches the HTTP method of a request.

URLPath.documentation: Matches the path from a request URL.

Version.documentation: The version of the sampling rule format (1).

SamplingRateBoost.documentation: Specifies the multiplier applied to the base sampling rate. This boost allows you to temporarily increase sampling without changing the rule's configuration.

SamplingRule.documentation: A sampling rule that services use to decide whether to instrument a request. Rule fields can match properties of the service, or properties of a request. The service can ignore rules that don't match its properties.

RuleName.documentation: The name of the sampling rule. Specify a rule by either name or ARN, but not both.

RuleARN.documentation: The ARN of the sampling rule. Specify a rule by either name or ARN, but not both.

ResourceARN.documentation: Matches the ARN of the Amazon Web Services resource on which the service runs.

FixedRate.documentation: The percentage of matching requests to instrument, after the reservoir is exhausted.

ReservoirSize.documentation: A fixed number of matching requests to instrument per second, prior to applying the fixed rate. The reservoir is not used directly by services, but applies to all services using the rule collectively.

Host.documentation: Matches the hostname from a request URL.

ServiceName.documentation: Matches the name that the service uses to identify itself in segments.

ServiceType.documentation: Matches the origin that the service uses to identify its type in segments.

HTTPMethod.documentation: Matches the HTTP method of a request.

URLPath.documentation: Matches the path from a request URL.

SamplingRateBoost.documentation: Specifies the multiplier applied to the base sampling rate. This boost allows you to temporarily increase sampling without changing the rule's configuration.

SamplingRuleUpdate.documentation: A document specifying changes to a sampling rule's configuration.

Timestamp.documentation: The start time of the reporting window.

RequestCount.documentation: The number of requests that matched the rule.

BorrowCount.documentation: The number of requests recorded with borrowed reservoir quota.

SamplingStatisticSummary.documentation: Aggregated request sampling data for a sampling rule across all services for a 10-second window.

ClientID.documentation: A unique identifier for the service in hexadecimal.

RequestCount.documentation: The number of requests that matched the rule.

BorrowCount.documentation: The number of requests recorded with borrowed reservoir quota.

SamplingStatisticsDocument.documentation: Request sampling results for a single rule from a service. Results are for the last 10 seconds unless the service has been assigned a longer reporting interval after a previous call to GetSamplingTargets.

SamplingStrategy.documentation: The name and value of a sampling rule to apply to a trace summary.

FixedRate.documentation: The percentage of matching requests to instrument, after the reservoir is exhausted.

ReservoirQuota.documentation: The number of requests per second that X-Ray allocated for this service.

Interval.documentation: The number of seconds for the service to wait before getting sampling targets again.

SamplingBoost.documentation: The sampling boost that X-Ray allocated for this service.

SamplingTargetDocument.documentation: Temporary changes to a sampling rule configuration. To meet the global sampling target for a rule, X-Ray calculates a new reservoir for each service based on the recent sampling results of all services that called GetSamplingTargets.

Segment.documentation:
A segment from a trace that has been ingested by the X-Ray service. The segment can be compiled from documents uploaded with PutTraceSegments, or an inferred segment for a downstream service, generated from a subsegment sent by the service that called it.

For the full segment document schema, see Amazon Web Services X-Ray segment documents in the Amazon Web Services X-Ray Developer Guide.

ReferenceId.documentation: Identifier for the service. Unique within the service map.

Names.documentation: A list of names for the service, including the canonical name.

Root.documentation: Indicates that the service was the first service to process a request.

AccountId.documentation: Identifier of the Amazon Web Services account in which the service runs.

Type.documentation:
The type of service.

  • Amazon Web Services Resource - The type of an Amazon Web Services resource. For example, AWS::EC2::Instance for an application running on Amazon EC2 or AWS::DynamoDB::Table for an Amazon DynamoDB table that the application used.

  • Amazon Web Services Service - The type of an Amazon Web Services service. For example, AWS::DynamoDB for downstream calls to Amazon DynamoDB that didn't target a specific table.

  • client - Represents the clients that sent requests to a root service.

  • remote - A downstream service of indeterminate type.

StartTime.documentation: The start time of the first segment that the service generated.

EndTime.documentation: The end time of the last segment that the service generated.

DurationHistogram.documentation: A histogram that maps the spread of service durations.

ResponseTimeHistogram.documentation: A histogram that maps the spread of service response times.

Service.documentation: Information about an application that processed requests, users that made requests, or downstream services, resources, and applications that an application used.

OkCount.documentation: The number of requests that completed with a 2xx Success status code.

ErrorStatistics.documentation: Information about requests that failed with a 4xx Client Error status code.

FaultStatistics.documentation: Information about requests that failed with a 5xx Server Error status code.

TotalResponseTime.documentation: The aggregate response time of completed requests.

Span.documentation: A span from a trace that has been ingested by the X-Ray service. A span represents a unit of work or an operation performed by a service.

TraceIds.documentation: Specify the trace IDs of the traces to be retrieved.

StartTime.documentation: The start of the time range to retrieve traces. The range is inclusive, so the specified start time is included in the query. Specified as epoch time, the number of seconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.

EndTime.documentation: The end of the time range to retrieve traces. The range is inclusive, so the specified end time is included in the query. Specified as epoch time, the number of seconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.

Key.documentation: A tag key, such as Stage or Name. A tag key cannot be empty. The key can be a maximum of 128 characters, and can contain only Unicode letters, numbers, or separators, or the following special characters: + - = . _ : /

Value.documentation: An optional tag value, such as Production or test-only. The value can be a maximum of 255 characters, and contain only Unicode letters, numbers, or separators, or the following special characters: + - = . _ : /

Tag.documentation:
A map that contains tag keys and tag values to attach to an Amazon Web Services X-Ray group or sampling rule. For more information about ways to use tags, see Tagging Amazon Web Services resources in the Amazon Web Services General Reference.

The following restrictions apply to tags:

  • Maximum number of user-applied tags per resource: 50

  • Tag keys and values are case sensitive.

  • Don't use aws: as a prefix for keys; it's reserved for Amazon Web Services use. You cannot edit or delete system tags.

ResourceARN.documentation: The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of an X-Ray group or sampling rule.

Tags.documentation:
A map that contains one or more tag keys and tag values to attach to an X-Ray group or sampling rule. For more information about ways to use tags, see Tagging Amazon Web Services resources in the Amazon Web Services General Reference.

The following restrictions apply to tags:

  • Maximum number of user-applied tags per resource: 50

  • Maximum tag key length: 128 Unicode characters

  • Maximum tag value length: 256 Unicode characters

  • Valid values for key and value: a-z, A-Z, 0-9, space, and the following characters: _ . : / = + - and @

  • Tag keys and values are case sensitive.

  • Don't use aws: as a prefix for keys; it's reserved for Amazon Web Services use. You cannot edit or delete system tags.

ThrottledException.documentation: The request exceeds the maximum number of requests per second.

Timestamp.documentation: Timestamp of the window for which statistics are aggregated.

ServiceForecastStatistics.documentation: The forecasted high and low fault count values.

ResponseTimeHistogram.documentation: The response time histogram for the selected entities.

TooManyTagsException.documentation: You have exceeded the maximum number of tags you can apply to this resource.

Id.documentation: The unique identifier for the request that generated the trace's segments and subsegments.

Duration.documentation: The length of time in seconds between the start time of the earliest segment that started and the end time of the last segment that completed.

LimitExceeded.documentation: LimitExceeded is set to true when the trace has exceeded the Trace document size limit. For more information about this limit and other X-Ray limits and quotas, see Amazon Web Services X-Ray endpoints and quotas.

Segments.documentation: Segment documents for the segments and subsegments that comprise the trace.

Trace.documentation: A collection of segment documents with matching trace IDs.

Id.documentation: The unique identifier for the request that generated the trace's segments and subsegments.

StartTime.documentation: The start time of a trace, based on the earliest trace segment start time.

Duration.documentation: The length of time in seconds between the start time of the earliest segment that started and the end time of the last segment that completed.

ResponseTime.documentation: The length of time in seconds between the start and end times of the root segment. If the service performs work asynchronously, the response time measures the time before the response is sent to the user, while the duration measures the amount of time before the last traced activity completes.

HasFault.documentation: The root segment document has a 500 series error.

HasError.documentation: The root segment document has a 400 series error.

HasThrottle.documentation: One or more of the segment documents has a 429 throttling error.

IsPartial.documentation: One or more of the segment documents is in progress.

Http.documentation: Information about the HTTP request served by the trace.

ServiceIds.documentation: Service IDs from the trace's segment documents.

ResourceARNs.documentation: A list of resource ARNs for any resource corresponding to the trace segments.

InstanceIds.documentation: A list of EC2 instance IDs for any instance corresponding to the trace segments.

AvailabilityZones.documentation: A list of Availability Zones for any zone corresponding to the trace segments.

FaultRootCauses.documentation: A collection of FaultRootCause structures corresponding to the trace segments.

ErrorRootCauses.documentation: A collection of ErrorRootCause structures corresponding to the trace segments.

ResponseTimeRootCauses.documentation: A collection of ResponseTimeRootCause structures corresponding to the trace segments.

MatchedEventTime.documentation: The matched time stamp of a defined event.

TraceSummary.documentation: Metadata generated from the segment documents in a trace.

TraceUser.documentation: Information about a user recorded in segment documents.

UnprocessedStatistics.documentation: Sampling statistics from a call to GetSamplingTargets that X-Ray could not process.

ErrorCode.documentation: The error that caused processing to fail.

UnprocessedTraceSegment.documentation: Information about a segment that failed processing.

ResourceARN.documentation: The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of an X-Ray group or sampling rule.

TagKeys.documentation: Keys for one or more tags that you want to remove from an X-Ray group or sampling rule.

GroupARN.documentation: The ARN that was generated upon creation.

FilterExpression.documentation: The updated filter expression defining criteria by which to group traces.

InsightsConfiguration.documentation:
The structure containing configurations related to insights.

  • The InsightsEnabled boolean can be set to true to enable insights for the group or false to disable insights for the group.

  • The NotificationsEnabled boolean can be set to true to enable insights notifications for the group. Notifications can only be enabled on a group with InsightsEnabled set to true.

Group.documentation: The group that was updated. Contains the name of the group that was updated, the ARN of the group that was updated, the updated filter expression, and the updated insight configuration assigned to the group.

Name.documentation: Name of the indexing rule to be updated.

Destination.documentation: The configured destination of trace segments.
The destination of the trace segments.

documentation: Amazon Web Services X-Ray provides APIs for managing debug traces and retrieving service maps and other data created by processing those traces.
